page.title: 01Southern Slopes of Morven
page.content: The E/W ridge of Morven Hill defines the northern boundary of this area. The steep grassy slopes of this hill lead southwards and downwards to an extensive more gently sloping region that forms the headwaters area of the Tullich and Coldstane burns. Because of the underlying basic igneous rocks, this area is also grassy and forms excellent summer pasture for cattle. Many small streams flow into the Tullich Burn Valley, including the captures headwaters of the Coldstane Burn. Local erosion of the grassy turf reveals a considerable accumulation of peat in the flattest parts. Heather reasserts itself into the granite southern part of the block. The area is uninhabited, but is much appreciated by those hillwalkers who make the effort to experience its
